# Relationships

This chapter talks about relationships between variables as revealed by point plots.

## Learning outcomes

After working though this chapter, you will be able to:

- given a scatterplot of two numeric variables, determine if the two variables are related
- given a scatterplot of two numeric variables that are related, identify if there is a positive or negative relationship
- given a scatterplot of a numeric variable againbst a categorical variable, identify if there is a relationship between the variables
- explain why the terms *positive* and *negative* do not apply when a categorical variable is involved in the relationship
